Name: breast lobular carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that derives_from breast lobules (milk glands).

Name: luminal breast carcinoma
Definition: A Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome that has_material_basis_in homozygous mutation in the gene encoding palladin (BLOC1S6) on chromosome 15q21.

Name: breast ductal carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that derives_from the lining of milk ducts.

Name: breast adenocarcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that originates in the milk ducts and/or lobules (glandular tissue) of the breast.

Name: breast metaplastic carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that represents a mixed group of malignant neoplasms characterized by the histologic presence of two or more cellular types.

Name: breast adenoid cystic carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is characterized by the presence of a dual cell population of luminal and basaloid cells arranged in specific growth patterns.

Name: Ehrlich tumor carcinoma
Definition: A vulvar benign neoplasm of neural origin that is characterized by round to polyhedral cells with indistinct margins and granular cytoplasm due to the accumulation of lysosomes. They occur in ribbons or clumps separated by hyalinised stroma and collaged fibers with uniform

Name: breast papillary carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is characterized by the presence of arborescent fibrovascular stalks lined by epithelial cells
Synonym: solid papillary carcinoma of the breast

Name: lipid-rich carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant epithelial cells with clear cytoplasm which contains neutral lipids.

Name: obsolete invasive carcinoma
Definition: A carcinoma that results_in a lesion that breaks through the boundary located_in the duct or located_in the lobule.

Name: cribriform carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is characterized by an irregular cribriform growth pattern

Name: sebaceous breast carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is characterized by a lobular or nested growth pattern of tumor cells variably admixed with cells displaying sebaceous differentiation. It is a distinct variant of invasive ductal carcinoma.

Name: nipple carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is located_in the nipple.

Name: breast large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is characterized by large cell size

Name: bilateral breast cancer
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is characterized by an individual having breast cancer in both breasts

Name: breast myoepithelial carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinome that is composed entirely or almost entirely of malignant spindle cells with myoepithelial differentiation.

Name: breast scirrhous carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is characterized by the presence of hard

Name: female breast carcinoma
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is manifested in the female breast.

Name: obsolete vascular hemorrhagic disorder
Definition: A breast carcinoma that is manifested in the female breast.

Name: sporadic breast cancer
Definition: A breast carcinoma that occurs in people who do not have a family history of that cancer or an inherited change in their DNA that would increase their risk for that cancer.
